fields.headline: Injured rider improves
fields.bodyText: Amateur rider Tom Thompson was yesterday reported to be in a "comfortable" condition in North Tees Hospital after a crashing fall at Sedgefield on Wednesday. The rider suffered a head injury when parting company from Just Tom in the Wares Teesside Hurdle. Just Tom was in third place when he hit the top of the second flight falling heavily, and Thompson, having been hurled to the ground, then appeared to be kicked by a following horse. Thompson, who was having his first ride in public, was knocked unconscious in the fall and is in the intensive care unit at the Stockton hospital. A hospital spokesperson said: "He's comfortable."
